2
March 19f 1969
Mr. Martin Palmer
General Manager
Pacific Broadcasting System
4108 N. W. Fruit Valley Road
Vancouver, Washington 98660
Dear Mr. Palmer:
Your letter dated February 29 to the Corporation for
Public Broadcasting has been responded to by an
official of the Corporation. In addition, accopy of
the correspondence was routed to me for comment.
National Educational Radio is currently the principal
distributor of programs to educational radio stations
^ in the United States. Our experience indicates that
few stations are interested in the type service you
provide.
In addition, the programs you listed are generally
available through a variety of means at limited cost.
While the final decision is the Corporationâ€™s, my
judgment is that there would be little support from
non-commercial stations to your proposed program
service.
Sincerely,
Robert A. Mott
RAM: lkl
cc: Robert D. Swezey
